sentence.Network_en: She was small and fragile and looked incongruous in an army uniform.
sentence.Network_cn: 她又小又弱，穿一身军装看起来很不协调。

sentence.Network_en: Such traditional methods seem incongruous in our technical age.
sentence.Network_cn: 此类传统方法似乎同我们今天的科技时代格格不入。

sentence.Network_en: A fur coat is incongruous with a bathing suit.
sentence.Network_cn: 皮大衣和游泳衣是不相称的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin incongruus (from in- 'not' + congruus 'agreeing, suitable', from the verb congruere) + -ous

entry.tran: 不合适的;不和谐的;不相称的
entry.def: Someone or something that is incongruous seems strange when considered together with other aspects of a situation.

example.ex: She was small and fragile and looked incongruous in an army uniform...
example.tran: 她又小又弱,穿一身军装看起来很不协调。

example.ex: The Indian temple is an incongruous sight in the Welsh border country.
example.tran: 坐落在威尔士边界乡村里的印度庙宇看上去相当突兀。

means.word_mean: 1. lacking in harmony or compatibility or appropriateness;

sentences.sentence: "a joke that was incongruous with polite conversation"

auth_sentence.content: These inclusions would seem incongruous on a genuine Cairo session.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: These inclusions would seem incongruous on a genuine Cairo session.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe someday humanity will uncover the reason for incongruous behaviors.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maybe someday humanity will uncover the reason for incongruous behaviors.

auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe someday humanity will uncover the reason for our incongruous behaviors.

means.word_mean: 不协调的, 不和谐的, 不一致的, 不相称的

sentences.en: It was incongruous to see a thief sitting there cheek by jowl with the policeman.
sentences.cn: 一个小偷同一个警察亲切地坐在一起,这看上去很不协调。

sentences.en: I found the scene somewhat incongruous.
sentences.cn: 我发觉布景有点不协调。

sentences.en: These remarks don’t have any relationship to the problem at hand;they are incongruous and should be stricken from the record.
sentences.cn: 这些话与眼下的问题无关, 它们是不恰当的, 应从记录中删除。
